New Records: Virat Kohli scored his first international century in nearly 3 years, reaching his 71st international hundred.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar achieved career-best bowling figures of 5/4.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 122 off 61 balls, including 12 fours and 6 sixes.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took 5 wickets for 4 runs, dismantling Afghanistan's top order.
Afghanistan ended their innings at 111/8 in 20 overs.
KL Rahul scored 62 off 41 balls with six boundaries and two sixes.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, and Yuzvendra Chahal were rested for the match.
Afghanistan bowlers appeared jaded after an emotionally charged match against Pakistan the previous night.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed relief and joy after scoring his century, indicating the significance of the milestone for him.
The match was considered inconsequential as India was already out of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was described as a 'dead rubber' in the Asia Cup.
Kohli's century was achieved while opening the innings in the absence of regular skipper Rohit Sharma.
